intro: Aspidixia anceps, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flax, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. Aspidixia anceps is typically found in grasslands and rocky areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils. It is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
